alert.note: Alert for Orange; Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 7:31AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including Orange County, portions of Riverside and San Bernardino counties including the cities of Riverside, San Bernardino, and Ontario. * WHEN...Until 900 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water ponding on roads during the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 726 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rain. Areas of minor flooding have been reported in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.50 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are expected over the area in the next hour. Additional rounds of heavy rainfall are expected later this morning into the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Santa Ana, Riverside, Irvine, San Bernardino, Fontana, Moreno Valley, Huntington Beach, San Clemente, Garden Grove and Ontario. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
